title: Ark.Alliance Trading Ecosystem
description: A high-frequency crypto trading bot and ecosystem featuring a cyberpunk dashboard, real-time WebSocket streaming, and AI-driven trend detection. Built on a microservices architecture with a focus on resilience and speed.

features.title: Strategy Command Center
features.description: The central nerve center of the operation. Visualizes PnL in real-time with sub-millisecond updates via WebSockets. The 'Cyberpunk' aesthetic isn't just for show—it uses high-contrast neon elements to make critical alerts visible instantly.

features.title: 3D Market Topography
features.description: Interactive Three.js visualization of the order book. Peaks and valleys represent buy/sell walls. This allows the trader to 'Surf the Wave' by visually identifying support and resistance zones in 3D space.

features.title: AI Logic Analysis
features.description: Real-time introspection into the 'Gemini' AI Strategy. Shows the calculated 'Sigma' (volatility threshold) and 'Trend Confidence' score. This is where the 'Wait' vs 'Trade' decisions happen.

features.title: Logistics Matrix
features.description: A grid view for managing hundreds of concurrent 'Worker' instances. Each cell represents a Docker container running a specific strategy on a specific pair. Green = Profit, Red = Inversion/Loss.

features.title: Configuration Console
features.description: Fine-grained control over the 'Click' parameters. Here you set the 'Take Profit Step' (e.g., 0.05%) and the 'Inversion Sigma'. Changes propagate to active instances immediately.

features.title: Execution Logs
features.description: Live stream of order execution events. Tracks latency statistics (e.g., 'Order to Ack: 45ms') and API weight usage to prevent bans.

pages.title: Surfing on the Wave
pages.content:
### Philosophy: Chaos as Potential

The **Ark.Alliance** strategy is built on a simple premise: *You cannot predict the ocean, but you can learn to surf.* 

Instead of trying to forecast price 10 minutes from now, the bot reacts to *micro-movements* in the present moment. We call this **'Click Strategy'**.

#### The 'Click' Mechanism

1.  **Entry (The Paddle)**: The bot enters a position based on **Gemini AI Analysis** of order book imbalance and volatility.
2.  **Surfing (The Ride)**: As price moves in favor, the bot executes 'Clicks'—partial take-profits at fixed intervals (e.g., every +0.1% PnL).
    *   **Ratchet Effect**: Each click raises the 'Inversion Threshold' (Stop Loss), locking in gains.
3.  **Inversion (The Bail)**: If the wave breaks (price reverses), the bot hits the 'Inversion Threshold'.
    *   It instantly closes the position and flips to the opposite side (2x quantity).
    *   **Result**: The surfer catches the *new* wave immediately.

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> Entry
    Entry --> Surfing: Price Moves Up
    Surfing --> Click: +0.1% Gain
    Click --> Surfing: Raise Safety Net
    Surfing --> Inversion: Hit Safety Net
    Inversion --> [*]: Flip Position
```

pages.title: Engineering Resilience
pages.content:
### Speed vs. Reliability

Crypto markets are 24/7 and unforgiving. The bot's architecture prioritizes **Resilience** over raw speed, though it achieves both.

#### 1. Hybrid Push/Pull Architecture

Reliance on WebSockets alone is dangerous (silent disconnects). Reliability on Polling alone is too slow. We use **Both**.

*   **Fast Path (Push)**: `BinanceUserDataStream` delivers order updates in ~50ms.
*   **Safe Path (Pull)**: A `MonitoringLayout` polls the API every 200ms. If the WebSocket misses an event, the Poller catches it.

#### 2. Fee Management & Pre-Computation

Trading frequently ('Clicking') accumulates fees. Ignorance of fees leads to 'Death by a Thousand Cuts'.

*   **Maker vs Taker**: The bot prefers `POST_ONLY` (Maker) orders to gain rebates.
*   **Pre-Computation**: Before placing *any* trade, the `FuturesCost Service` calculates:
    *   `OpenFee` + `CloseFee` + `FundingCost`
    *   **Rule**: The first 'Click' target is moved *further out* to cover these costs. You are never 'Green' until the fees are paid.

#### 3. Rate Limit Arbitrage

Binance allows 1200 weight/minute. 
*   The **RateLimiter** service tracks usage in real-time.
*   If usage > 80%, it switches non-critical polls to 'Lazy Mode', saving bandwidth for critical 'Inversion' orders.

```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
    participant Bot
    participant RateLimiter
    participant Binance

    Bot->>RateLimiter: Can I Order?
    RateLimiter->>RateLimiter: Check Weight (1100/1200)
    alt Critical (Inversion)
        RateLimiter-->>Bot: YES (Emergency Override)
    else Standard (Poll)
        RateLimiter-->>Bot: PAUSE (Save for Trade)
    end
    Bot->>Binance: Execute Order
```
